life
one love I'm your host Brian Kenny and

written over a hundred cases on those

Katie hood was my student and graduated
from Harvard
school in 2001 she joined the Michael J
Fox foundation because she was
interested in social enterprise and
doing good and had a remarkable run
there and then was that a transition
point and what we know about human

that you kind of see the metal of the

and at this time she was considering
remaining a full-time mom and at the

asking herself questions like why is
this happening why have we evolved as a

importance of symmetry in relationships
in the importance that humans place on
being connected and being invested in a
relationship where both parties are

interested in finding a protagonist who

in moving through a transition and here
she was being asked to lead this

treated although and they dated for two
three years
and she had another date and her old

brought out some behaviors in him that
really frightened a lot of different
people and he went and that late at
night basically attacked her and then
the next morning when her roommates came
back she wasn't alive and the part that
is important about this situation is is
that every person in that community in
that ecosystem said you know I worried
about him and yet nobody said anything
nobody a step forward and said I don't

happened is Yardley's mother and sister

then the question is as the business
question is is how do you create a

violence yeah and one other thing that
was important about that case because I
remember it well it was it made national
headlines
they were both Division one athletes
playing for one of the best-known
lacrosse programs in the country
this brought attention to this
particular case where as you know these
kinds of incidents have been happening
and continue to happen for a long time
very much under the radar screen five
years ago a woman came to me and said
I'd like to do a study on on how

interviews on campus and there were 200

reason the men in our culture haven't

understand the concept of control they
haven't learned
to problem-solve and many of I'm making

haven't figured out how to deal with
their own emotions and one of the things

to teach our students about having the

I didn't want to hurt him by leaving the

in this whole movement is that when

yeah and she goes to the high schools

is moving from talking about just

relationships
it's a reframe and it gives people it

age
so that they can begin to have

understand how
